member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Analysis.Ext.SingleCharTokenAnalyzer
T:Lucene.Net.Analysis.Ext.UnaccentedWordAnalyzer
member.summary:
Another Analyzer. Every char which is not a letter or digit is treated as a word separator. [Name.Surname@gmail.com 123.456 ğüşıöç%ĞÜŞİÖÇ$ΑΒΓΔΕΖ#АБВГДЕ SSß] will be tokenized as [name surname gmail com 123 456 gusioc gusioc αβγδεζ абвгде ssss]
No problem with searches like someuser@gmail or 123.456 since they are converted to phrase-query as "someuser gmail" or "123 456".

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Analysis.Ext.LetterOrDigitTokenizer
member.summary: if a char is not a letter or digit, it is a word separator

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.AbstractSegmentCache
member.summary: Root custom cache to allow a factory to retain references to the custom caches without having to be aware of the type.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.AbstractSegmentCache.Warm(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader,System.String)
member.summary: Used to warm up the cache.
member.param: The reader to warm the cache for.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1
member.summary: Custom cache with two levels of keys, outer key is the IndexReader with the inner key being a string, commonly a field name but can be anything. Refer to the unit tests for an example implementation. The type that is being cached.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.readerCache
member.summary: The cache - outer key is the reader, inner key is the field name. Value is the item desired.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.cacheLock
member.summary: Lock to use when accessing the cache.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.CreateValue(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader,System.String)
member.summary: Value creation.
member.param: The key to the item under the reader.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.Warm(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader,System.String)
member.summary: Warm the cache - simply calls Get and ignores the return value.
member.param: The index reader to warm up.
The key of the item under the reader.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.Get(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader,System.String)
member.summary: Get the item from the cache.
member.param: The IndexReader the cache is from.
The key of the item under the reader.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.KeyCount
member.summary: The number of outermost keys in the collection.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.WeakKey
member.summary: A weak referene wrapper for the hashtable keys. Whenever a key\value pair is added to the hashtable, the key is wrapped using a WeakKey. WeakKey saves the value of the original object hashcode for fast comparison.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.WeakKey.hashCode
member.summary: The hashcode for the target.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.WeakKey.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Create a new WeakKey
member.param: The object to use as the target.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.WeakKey.GetHashCode
member.summary: The hash code accessor.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Util.Cache.SegmentCache`1.WeakKey.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Equality between keys.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit
member.summary:
Class that will force an index writer to open an index based on the generation in the segments.gen file as opposed to the highest generation found in a directory listing.
A use case for using this IndexCommit when opening an IndexWriter would be if index snapshots (source) are being copied over an existing index (target) and the source now has a lower generation than the target due to initiating a rebuild of the index.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit.directory
member.summary: The index.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit.generation
member.summary: The generation to use.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit.#ctor(Lucene.Net.Store.Directory)
member.summary: Ctor.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit.GetSegmentsFileName
member.summary: Get the segments_n file for the generation found in the segments.gen file.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Index.SegmentsGenCommit.ReadDirectory
member.summary: Read the segments.gen file to get the generation number.
